title: Latent FXLMS: Accelerating Active Noise Control with Neural Adaptive Filters
author: Kanad Sarkar (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign), Austin Lu (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign), Manan Mittal (Stony Brook University), Yongjie Zhuang (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign), Ryan M. Corey (University of Illinois Chicago), Andrew C. Singer (University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign), ..., Amazon Web Services
relevance_why: The proposed Latent Filtered-x Least Mean Squares algorithm leverages neural adaptive filters which could enhance Haohe Liu's research in audio generation and enhancement by potentially improving sound cancellation techniques during audio manipulation tasks.
background: Active Noise Control aims to reduce unwanted sound at a listener's location using adaptive filters calculated based on noise characteristics.
contribution: This paper introduces the Latent FXLMS algorithm that accelerates the convergence of active noise control systems by adapting filter weights in a lower-dimensional latent space instead of directly updating them, achieving faster convergence with comparable steady-state error to traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like the standard Filtered-x Least Mean Squares (FxLMS) directly adapted weight coefficients, which led to slower convergence in dynamically changing environments.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by constraining the adaptive filter weights to a learned manifold via an autoencoder, leading to an evident faster convergence in filter adaptation.

key_innovation: Utilizes a neural network-based approach to constrain the adaptation of filter weights, enabling efficient convergence and robustness in dynamic acoustic environments.
real_world_impact: By integrating neural networks with adaptive noise control, this research has potential applications in enhancing noise cancellation technologies in consumer electronics and automotive systems.

new_terms.Latent FXLMS: **Latent Filtered-x Least Mean Squares** is a novel adaptation of the traditional FxLMS algorithm that operates in a constrained latent space, improving convergence speed in active noise control applications.
